column4: hello everyone... I have a real frustrating problem... my cdrom doesn't wish to eject... umount: /media/cdrom0: device is busy
this happened before but enough is enough... it really is frustrating
can anyone please be kind enough to help me out
check the ubuntu starter guide for mounting windows within linux
i dont know where that si
is there anyway to get the guide with apt-get?
I don't believe Ubuntu will let you write to your Windows drive.... I believe it will mount read only
actually, i dont need to download the unofficial guide right? I can just read it from this site?
all i really want to do with the files on windows is play them in xmms
I love linux though, and i have random ass problems with windows even though i maintain it so well:-/
like I can visit my website but i cant login to control panel, ftp and email
but i can login to any other website's control panel, email and ftp
Im playing music from my Windows HD!
